BackstoryDef.title: failed psycaster
BackstoryDef.description: After attending a university for psycasters, [PAWN_nameDef] discovered [PAWN_pronoun] was uniquely unqualified. [PAWN_possessive] professors described [PAWN_objective] as the "psychic equivalent of the number zero."\n\nDespite having the spirit of a psycaster, [PAWN_possessive] survival was better attributed to having the body of a long distance sprinter.

BackstoryDef.title: rimworld tourist
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] hailed from a world where gold was amazingly common. [PAWN_pronoun] travelled to many worlds and recorded [PAWN_possessive] experiences in the famous novel "What I Did on my Holidays."

BackstoryDef.title: colony patrician
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] ruled a sizable colony on the Rim as dictator in all but name. [PAWN_possessive] colony thrived under [PAWN_possessive], as [PAWN_possessive] ruled with more of a velvet glove, rather than an iron fist, following [PAWN_possessive] family's motto of "si non confectus, non reficiat."\n\n[PAWN_possessive] other great joy, besides ensuring the colony ran like clockwork, was pampering [PAWN_possessive] dog.

BackstoryDef.title: Uncanny assassin
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was raised as an assassin from a young age and became near infamous in certain circles for a series of particularly innovative and brutal murders. [PAWN_possessive] mind has been likened to a shattered mirror - something brilliant, sharp, and dazzling, but also fundamentally and irrevocably broken.

BackstoryDef.title: reformed conman
BackstoryDef.description: Wanted dead in multiple colonies for [PAWN_possessive] cons, [PAWN_nameDef] was finally caught and hung within a literal inch of [PAWN_possessive] life. Afterwards, [PAWN_pronoun] was given the chance to turn [PAWN_possessive] life around, applying [PAWN_possessive] skills at repairing some of the failing institutions of a large colony.

BackstoryDef.title: sausage salesman
BackstoryDef.description: On every world along the rim and core, there would be someone like [PAWN_nameDef], someone who would be selling sausages of suspicious origin and at such a low price that [PAWN_pronoun] would insist "that it's cutting me own throat."\n\nPerhaps the most astonishing thing was that despite the fact that [PAWN_nameDef]'s sausages tasted objectively terrible, people would find themselves buying another some time later.
